JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Intelligence and Space (RI&S), we aspire to be the most admired defense and aerospace systems supplier through world-class people and technology. Raytheon designs, develops, produces and supports a vast array of electro-optical/infrared sensors, active electronically scanned array/scanning radars, and various integrated systems solutions to provide customers with actionable information for strike, persistent surveillance, and special mission applications.  These best-in-class systems perform detection, identification, tracking, targeting, navigation, weather, and situational awareness tasks from a variety of airborne platforms including maritime, littoral and overland patrol aircraft, unmanned aerial systems, and other tactical, attack and transport rotary and fixed wing aircraft.    This position supports the Trusted Mission Processing (TMP) product area within the Communications and Air Management Systems (CAMS) segment of Raytheon.  TMP provides secured processing platforms and capabilities to both domestic and international customers. This specific position will provide software architecture leadership and support to new and existing programs within the mission area.  The successful candidate will have a proven track record developing and augmenting software architectures that meet technical requirements of the product while balancing system level concerns as well as program cost and schedule constraints.   The candidate will support product area proposal efforts by developing concept architectures, support the development of detailed architecture development for new programs, extend existing software architectures to meet new program requirements and will oversee the application and instantiation of architectures into the software design.  The successful candidate must be able to effectively communicate architecture approach, constraints, and rationale to varied audiences including multiple levels of management and to the customer.  Candidate must also be able to guide the successful implementation of that architecture.      Required Skills:  Minimum of 10 years real time embedded software development experiencePrior experience as a Software Architect for real time embedded systemStrong understanding of architecture design principles and governance   Ability to create an architectural vision and successfully lead a team in its implementation  Strong written, verbal and presentation skills.
